org.opendaylight.controller.flowprogrammer.northbound

Class FlowProgrammerNorthbound

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.opendaylight.controller.flowprogrammer.northbound.FlowProgrammerNorthbound

  • public class FlowProgrammerNorthbound
extends java.lang.Object
    Flow Configuration Northbound API provides capabilities to program flows.

    Authentication scheme : HTTP Basic
    Authentication realm : opendaylight
    Transport : HTTP and HTTPS

    HTTPS Authentication is disabled by default.

      • getStaticFlows

        public FlowConfigs getStaticFlows(java.lang.String containerName,
                         java.lang.String queryString)
        Returns a list of Flows configured on the given container
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        Returns:
        List of flows configured on a given container 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/flowprogrammer/default

 Response body in XML:
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
 <list>
        <flowConfig>
               <installInHw>true</installInHw>
               <name>flow1</name>
               <node>
                      <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</id>
                      <type>OF</type>
               </node>
               <ingressPort>1</ingressPort>
               <priority>500</priority>
               <etherType>0x800</etherType>
               <nwSrc>9.9.1.1</nwSrc>
               <actions>OUTPUT=2</actions>
        </flowConfig>
 </list>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
   "flowConfig": [
      {
         "installInHw": "true",
         "name": "flow1",
         "node": {
            "type": "OF",
            "id": "00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01"
         },
         "ingressPort": "1",
         "priority": "500",
         "etherType": "0x800",
         "nwSrc":"9.9.1.1",
         "actions": [
           "OUTPUT=2"
         ]
      }
    ]
 }

      • getStaticFlows

        public FlowConfigs getStaticFlows(java.lang.String containerName,
                         java.lang.String nodeType,
                         java.lang.String nodeId,
                         java.lang.String queryString)
        Returns a list of Flows configured on a Node in a given container
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01')
        Returns:
        List of flows configured on a Node in a container 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/flowprogrammer/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01

 Response body in XML:
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
 <list>
        <flowConfig>
               <installInHw>true</installInHw>
               <name>flow1</name>
               <node>
                      <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</id>
                      <type>OF</type>
               </node>
               <ingressPort>1</ingressPort>
               <priority>500</priority>
               <etherType>0x800</etherType>
               <nwSrc>9.9.1.1</nwSrc>
               <actions>OUTPUT=2</actions>
        </flowConfig>
 </list>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
   "flowConfig": [
      {
         "installInHw": "true",
         "name": "flow1",
         "node": {
            "type": "OF",
            "id": "00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01"
         },
         "ingressPort": "1",
         "priority": "500",
         "etherType": "0x800",
         "nwSrc":"9.9.1.1",
         "actions": [
           "OUTPUT=2"
         ]
       }
    ]
 }

      • getStaticFlow

        public FlowConfig getStaticFlow(java.lang.String containerName,
                       java.lang.String nodeType,
                       java.lang.String nodeId,
                       java.lang.String name)
        Returns the flow configuration matching a human-readable name and nodeId on a given Container.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01')
        name - Human-readable name for the configured flow (Eg. 'Flow1')
        Returns:
        Flow configuration matching the name and nodeId on a Container 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/flowprogrammer/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/staticFlow/flow1

 Response body in XML:
 <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8" standalone="yes"?>
 <flowConfig>
        <installInHw>true</installInHw>
        <name>flow1</name>
        <node>
               <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</id>
               <type>OF</type>
        </node>
        <ingressPort>1</ingressPort>
        <priority>500</priority>
        <etherType>0x800</etherType>
        <nwSrc>9.9.1.1</nwSrc>
        <actions>OUTPUT=2</actions>
 </flowConfig>

 Response body in JSON:
 {
    "installInHw":"true",
    "name":"flow1",
    "node":{
       "id":"00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "type":"OF"
    },
    "ingressPort":"1",
    "priority":"500",
    "etherType":"0x800",
    "nwSrc":"9.9.1.1",
    "actions":[
       "OUTPUT=2"
    ]
 }

      • addOrModifyFlow

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response addOrModifyFlow(java.lang.String containerName,
                                        java.lang.String name,
                                        java.lang.String nodeType,
                                        java.lang.String nodeId,
                                        FlowConfig flowConfig)
        Add or Modify a flow configuration. If the flow exists already, it will replace the current flow.
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01')
        name - Name of the Static Flow configuration (Eg. 'Flow2')
        FlowConfig - Flow Configuration in JSON or XML format
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response Status code 
        
 Example:

 Request URL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/flowprogrammer/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/staticFlow/flow1

 Request body in XML:
 <flowConfig>
            <installInHw>true</installInHw>
            <name>flow1</name>
            <node>
                   <id>00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01</id>
                   <type>OF</type>
            </node>
            <ingressPort>1</ingressPort>
            <priority>500</priority>
            <etherType>0x800</etherType>
            <nwSrc>9.9.1.1</nwSrc>
            <actions>OUTPUT=2</actions>
 </flowConfig>

 Request body in JSON:
 {
    "installInHw":"true",
    "name":"flow1",
    "node":{
       "id":"00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01",
       "type":"OF"
    },
    "ingressPort":"1",
    "priority":"500",
    "etherType":"0x800",
    "nwSrc":"9.9.1.1",
    "actions":[
       "OUTPUT=2"
    ]
 }

      • deleteFlow

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response deleteFlow(java.lang.String containerName,
                                   java.lang.String name,
                                   java.lang.String nodeType,
                                   java.lang.String nodeId)
        Delete a Flow configuration
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01')
        name - Name of the Static Flow configuration (Eg. 'Flow1')
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response code 
        
 Example:

 RequestURL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/flowprogrammer/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/staticFlow/flow1

      • toggleFlow

        public javax.ws.rs.core.Response toggleFlow(java.lang.String containerName,
                                   java.lang.String nodeType,
                                   java.lang.String nodeId,
                                   java.lang.String name)
        Toggle a Flow configuration
        Parameters:
        containerName - Name of the Container (Eg. 'default')
        nodeType - Type of the node being programmed (Eg. 'OF')
        nodeId - Node Identifier (Eg. '00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01')
        name - Name of the Static Flow configuration (Eg. 'Flow1')
        Returns:
        Response as dictated by the HTTP Response code 
        
 Example:

 RequestURL:
 http://localhost:8080/controller/nb/v2/flowprogrammer/default/node/OF/00:00:00:00:00:00:00:01/staticFlow/flow1
